entries.meaning: (pathology, oncology) An abnormal new growth of disorganized tissue in animals or plants.
examples: Other and less common causes for an oromaxillary fistula are infections, cysts and neoplasms of the maxilla which may destroy the intervening bone, resulting in a fistula between the maxillary sinus and the oral cavity.
